incidents.name: Programmable Voice Queues Impacted

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Voice enqueuing/dequeuing of calls was degraded for 4 minutes between 15:55 and 15:59 Pacific Time on 07/01/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced issues with enqueuing and dequeuing voice calls and the creation of call queues. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating an issue with Voice-tms-edge host healthcheck failures and lazarus restart rate limiting in multiple regions

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the issue with Voice-tms-edge host healthcheck failures and lazarus restart rate limiting in multiple regions, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with voice-tms-edge host healthcheck failures and Lazarus restart rate limiting in multiple regions. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Super SIM and Programmable Wireless Connectivity Issues Due to Cellular Infrastructure Provider Incident

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting network connectivity for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

The impacted service provider has restored majority services to operation. 3 European networks 2G/3G connectivity remains blocked by the impacted provider, and they are working on a plan to bring those back online. We continue to see elevated signaling levels on the Super SIM product. Other down streams are reporting the same for themselves. We continue to monitor the recovery while metrics normalize.  We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Major US network operators are reporting problems with a common downstream service provider that manages roaming connections for various carriers. All major North American operators are involved in a multi-company bridge for troubleshooting. There is no estimated time of repair at this time. This may be causing some connectivity issues for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users, particularly on devices using 2G and 3G or SMS failures. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to see recovery of the network connectivity issue for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to see recovery of the network connectivity issue for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Major US network operators are reporting problems with a common downstream service provider that manages roaming connections for various carriers. All major North American operators are involved in a multi-company bridge for troubleshooting. There is no estimated time of repair at this time. This may be causing some connectivity issues for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users, particularly on devices using 2G and 3G or SMS failures. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Major US network operators are reporting problems with a common downstream service provider that manages roaming connections for various carriers. This may be causing some connectivity issues for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users, particularly on devices using 2G and 3G. We are still actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Major US network operators are reporting problems with a common downstream service provider that manages roaming connections for various carriers. This may be causing some connectivity issues for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users, particularly on devices using 2G and 3G. We are still actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
